newsitem.title: USA: Former Miami manager's trial delayed to Aug 4.
newsitem.headline: Former Miami manager's trial delayed to Aug 4.

text.p: The corruption trial of former Miami City Manager Cesar Odio was postponed to Aug 4.
Trial had been scheduled to begin Monday for Odio, 61, and lobbyist Jorge de Cardenas, 51, who are charged with conspiracy, wire fraud, mail fraud and witness tampering.
Thursday, U.S. District Judge K. Michael Moore granted defense attorneys' request to delay the trial, agreeing that recent publicity could make it difficult to choose an impartial jury.

Former city finance director Manohar Surana secretly tape-recorded a conversation in which Odio counted out money allegedly received from de Cardenas as a kickback on a city worker's compensation contract.
The tape is expected to be introduced as evidence in Odio's trial.
Excerpts from transcripts of the tape were published recently in local newspapers.
